questions.text: What was the name of President Bartlet's "new Charlie"?
questions.explanation:
Curtis.

	Charlie mentions his name when he sees the President in the kitchen of the residence and President Bartlet refers to Curtis as "no Charlie".

questions.text: How many times was Josh named in John Hoynes' book?
questions.explanation:
39.

	Donna unwrapped the book and gave it to Josh. With it, she told him that he was mentioned in the book thirty-nine times. Hoynes asked Josh if he would come and "be Leo to him" because he was running for President.

questions.text: Who crashed the photo opportunity between Baker and President Bartlet?
questions.explanation:
Vice President Russell.

	Will thought it would be a good idea for the President to be seen with Baker and the President so it didn't seem as if the President was endorsing Baker for President. After the photo op, the President told Vice President Russell never to do anything like that again.

questions.text: When the episode began, who was Josh watching on television?
questions.explanation:
John Hoynes.

	Josh wasn't the only one watching Hoynes being interviewed. Toby and CJ were watching him in Toby's office while Toby leafed through Hoynes' new book "Full Disclosure".

questions.text: Who was Debbie's first guess for the surprise musical guest at the National Arts dinner?
questions.explanation:
Jerry Garcia.

	The President told her that getting Jerry Garcia would have been a problem and later Debbie guessed that the musical guest was going to be Liberace.

questions.text: When Charlie tried to get the Taiwanese flag back, he found out that Bernard was now running the gift room.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bernard Thatch was first seen in the second season episode "Noel". Charlie learned that the former head of the gift department had been promoted and that Bernard was put in her place. Charlie finally got the flag back after introducing Bernard to a member of the counsel's office who had the US code memorized.

questions.text: Who was the musical guest for the awards dinner?
questions.explanation:
James Taylor.

	Margaret had been singing some of Paul Simon's songs during the episode and CJ scolded her for trying to give away the surprise guest. Margaret even tried to tell Donna, but Donna couldn't understand what Margaret was saying through her gritted teeth.

questions.text: Who did Josh make this comment to, "You used to love it when I couldn't dress myself without you"?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Donna's reaction to what Josh said was, "I used to love peppermint ice cream too, but now the little pieces of candy get stuck in your teeth in a way that I find irritating."

questions.text: What color did Carol say the flag was that the President accepted from Taiwan at the morning prayer breakfast?
questions.explanation:
Green.

	When Josh heard that the President had accepted it, he said, "No, no, no, no, no!" Later after telling CJ and Carol that the President accepted the flag from the Taiwanese independent movement and the Chinese were going to freak, he muttered. "I sound a little hysterical" to which CJ said, "Just a touch".

questions.text: What was the reason the President gave for accepting the Taiwanese flag?
questions.correct: He couldn't see out of his right eye
options: Curtis accepted it and the President was covering for him
He wanted to start trouble between China and the US
questions.explanation:
He couldn't see out of his right eye.

	President Bartlet admitted to Abbey during the awards ceremony that he had been having trouble seeing out of his right eye since the morning before.
